data.title: Broadway in Bryant Park 2024 Brings To The Stage The Great Gatsby, Moulin Rouge!, The Book of Mormon, Suffs, The Notebook and Chicago
data.meta_description: 106.7 LITE FM’s brought the next installment of Broadway in Bryant Park to the delight of audiences. The Bryant Park stage located at 6th Avenue between 40th…
data.text:
MR. DAREDEVIL — (Via Deadline) Wow. This isn’t your Netflix’s Daredevil. Visceral, cinematic, bloody — this is a Daredevil in the way that James Bond got a reboot with Daniel Craig.

The first look at the series was revealed Friday for the crowd at D23 in Anaheim. And there’s a big homage to Heat with Charlie Cox’s Matt Murdock and Vincent Donofiro’s Kingpin meeting in a diner to verbally draw their boundaries.

“If you step out of line, I’m going to be there,” says Murdock.

Kingpin, laughing, wonders if it’s Daredevil talking or Murdock.

In another shot, a prison inmate tells Murdock, “You don’t understand, people needed you.”

Also seen here is Jon Bernthal’s Frank Castle aka The Punisher, a long-haired ruffian who comes up against Murdock in fisticuffs before the former realizes it’s his ally.

The tagline that runs in the trailer: “The Devil’s Work Is Never Done.”

Marvel President Kevin Feige also confirmed a season 2 will be shooting soon.

Daredevil: Born Again follows original star Charlie Cox as Matt Murdock, a blind attorney-turned-crimefighting superhero, and also features Vincent D’Onofrio reprising his role as mob boss Wilson Fisk aka Kingpin and Jon Bernthal returning as Punisher.

The cast of Daredevil: Born Again also includes Margarita Levieva, Arty Froushan, Sandrine Holt, Michael Gandolfini and Nikki M. James.

We gotta wait till March 1, 2025 for Daredevil: Born Again.

I got to admit, it’s great to have the original Netflix-band back together, but somehow the trailer didn’t work for me. It looked somehow different. Take a look:

SNL AT 50 — Hard to believe but Saturday Night Live enters its 50th year in September. Save for a year, Lorne Michaels has been the conductor of the train the entire time. I’ve watch it since that first show, so I’m able to comment somewhat authoritatively on the trailer for the movie Saturday Night coming in October 11.

It looks pretty good. I know Jason Reitman is onboard, so it’ll be pretty much right-on. Take a look at the trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iZ9O_tl5Npk

and what the Daily Mail said: https://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-13727345/Saturday-Night-Live-movie-LOOK-Trailer-SNL-episode.html

SHORT TAKES — Micky Dolenz was at Mark Lapidos’ The Fest For Beatles Fans this weekend and is seen here with Billy J. Kramer. He also sang “Rocky Raccoon,” “Oh Darling” and “Johnny B Goode” backed by the Liverpool Band with Lawrence Juber from Wings joining in.

Our spy there said Dolenz took the SRO crowd back to the 60’s in fine fashion …. Playboy Magazine is issuing its first print-issue in decades. Read all about it: https://avn.com/business/articles/novelty/playboy-announces-return-to-print-revival-of-playmates-bunnies-934470.html?fbclid=IwY2xjawEkRPVleHRuA2FlbQIxMQABHQmnmG_FGc4hE8R6Kz_Q7GxZg-qHXUfHnel8rYqmtyoIvAWAIiA9dONdzQ_aem_M0kPD-EPqKmP3UFQgj-uK

For my money, Lanie Speiser should have been the new editor … Niki was tremendous on the CBS Saturday Sessions … Sad Deadline item about a forthcoming Gary Coleman documentary: uKAhttps://deadline.com/2024/08/gary-coleman-documentary-peacock-trailer-1236034809/

… CBS weather-guru John Elliot coined a new phrase I had never heard for last week’s epic rain-bursts: training rain …

Is the world ready for a live-Chicago recording froim 1971? Bring it on. Consistently one of the best groups around. Read about it here: https://theseconddisc.com/2024/08/06/chicago-kennedy-center-1971-cd-vinyl/ … Happy BDay Cori Gardner!

NAMES IN THE NEWS — Markos Papdatos; Lush Ice; Tyrone Bijan; Anthony Pomes; Frank Zappa; Joe Banadonna; Ray Sharkey; Mary Huhn; Don Kaplan; Michael Starr; Richard Johnson; AJ Benza; Elizabeth Stanton; Joel Diamond; Gloria Gaynor; Stan Lynch; Thomas Silverman; Steve Plotnicki; Manny Bella; Don Peppe; Alan Rothstein; Marl Alpert; Tom & Lisa Cuddy; Greg D’Alessandro and ZIGGY!

Images on this page have been licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 4.0 International license.

Did you know Bonnie & Clyde: The Musical was filmed live and can be streamed online On Demand? Filmed live at Theatre Royal Drury Lane during two special one-off concert stagings in January 2022, Bonnie & Clyde: The Musical stars Tony Award-nominee Jeremy Jordan as Clyde – reprising the role he originated in the Broadway premiere in 2011 – and Olivier Award-nominee Frances Mayli McCann as Bonnie, who went on to originate the role of Bonnie in the West End premiere run. The filmed concert staging also features George Maguire as Buck, Natalie McQueen as Blanche, Trevor Dion Nicholas as Preacher, Liam Tamne as Ted, Casey Al-Shaqsy as Stella, Simon Anthony as Cop/Bud/Archie/Deputy Johnson, Gillian Bevan as Cummie Barrow/Eleanor, Eloise Davies as Trish, Adrian Grove as Henry Barrow, Debbie Kurup as Governor Miriam Ferguson, Matthew Malthouse as Bob Alcorn, Jeremy Secomb as Judge/Sheriff Schmid, Russell Wilcox as Captain Frank Hamer, and Julie Yammanee as Emma Parker.

The two sold-out concerts in London were directed by Nick Winston. The fabulous score has music by multi-Grammy®, Tony® and Emmy® Award nominee Frank Wildhorn (Jekyll & Hyde, The Scarlett Pimpernell, Death Note), lyrics by Tony® and Oscar® winner Don Black (Sunset Boulevard, Aspects of Love), a book by Emmy® Award nominee Ivan Menchell (Blended [movie], The Cemetery Club, Death Note The Musical). Wildhorn, and Black were Tony-nominated for their score.

“Disney’s Snow White” a live action musical reimagining of the classic 1937 film just released their trailer. The magical music adventure journeys back to the timeless story with beloved characters Bashful, Doc, Dopey, Grumpy, Happy, Sleepy, and Sneezy. “Disney’s Snow White” is directed by Marc Webb and produced by Marc Platt and Jared LeBoff, with Callum McDougall serving as executive producer, and features all-new original songs from Benj Pasek and Justin Paul. Rachel Zegler and Gal Gadot star.

Speaking of Pasek and Paul, Hugh Jackman‘s passion project “The Greatest Showman” is finally getting a live stage show, thanks to Disney. At D23 in Anaheim on Friday, Disney showcased a medley of upcoming musical theater shows including dates for Frozen and Hercules that will debut on the West End. After a collection of rousing performances from the Lion King and Beauty and the Beast, to name, what was heard was “Ladies and gents, this is the moment you’ve waited for.” The crowd was then surprised with a rendition of “The Greatest Show,” from “The Greatest Showman.” Ryan Vasquez, who starred in The Notebook on Broadway, was dressed as Jackman’s character P. T. Barnum and accompanied four other cast members on stage under the signage “The Greatest Showman: The New Musical.” D23 host Yvette Nicole Brown said that the project was currently in development for a stage musical adaptation. The timing and the location have not been disclosed.

Also look for

Wicked: Release schedule for November 22, 2024 (Part 1); November 26, 2025 (Part 2) Starring Cynthia Erivo, Ariana Grande, Jonathan Bailey, Marissa Bode, Peter Dinklage, Jeff Goldblum, Ethan Slater and Michelle Yeoh.

Kiss Of The Spider Woman: Director: Bill Condon, starring Jennifer Lopez, Diego Luna and Tonatiuh. This is a film adaptation of John Kander, Fred Ebb, and Terrence McNally’s Tony Award-winning musical, based on the novel by Manuel Puig

Girl From The North Country: Screenplay and director Conor McPherson, starring Olivia Colman, Chlöe Bailey, Tosin Cole and Woody Harrelson.

In developement:

The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee: Walt Disney Pictures, Rideback

Bare: A Pop Opera: Screenplay and director Kristin Hanggi

Be More Chill: 21 Laps, Berlanti Productions

Beautiful: The Carole King MusicalL Production Company: Sony Pictures, Playtone. Screenplay: Lisa Cholodenko and Stuart Blumberg. Director: Lisa Cholodenko. Starring Daisy Edgar-Jones.

Big River: Screenplay: Douglas Lyons

Flower Drum Song: Concord Originals, 3AD, Janet Yang Productions

Follies: BBC Films, Heyday Films. Director: Dominic Cooke

Guys And Dolls: TriStar Pictures. Director: Bill Condon

Gypsy: New Regency. Director: Amy Sherman-Palladino

Joseph And The Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat: Amazon Studios, The Really Useful Group, Scott Sanders Productions. Screenplay: Daniel Goldfarb. Director: Jon M. Chu

Merrily We Roll Along: Blumhouse. Screenplay: Richard Linklater and Jonathan Marc Sherman. Director: Richard Linklater, starring Beanie Feldstein, Paul Mescal, Ben Platt, and Mallory Bechtel. A film adaptation of the George Furth-Stephen Sondheim musical, filmed over 20 years to recreate the amount of time the show covers.

On Your Feet: Sony Pictures. Screenplay and director Lissette Feliciano

Oliver!: Walt Disney Studios, Cube Vision, Marc Platt Productions. Screenplay: Danny Strong. Director: Thomas Kail, starring Ice Cube.

Shucked: Mandalay Pictures. Screenplay: Robert Horn
